name: Absolute's Talisman: Aid
summary: This spell allows the Absolute's Talisman's wearer to heal themselves for 5|Healing and increase their hit points for the same amount.
description: Heal yourself and increase your hit point maximum by 5|Healing.

name: Acid Splash
summary: It deals Acid damage to enemies in a small area.
description: Throw a bubble of acid that damages each creature it hits.
higherLevels:
When the spellcaster reaches Level 5, the damage increases by another d6|Acid Acid|1d6 Acid damage, for a total of 2d6|Acid.
When the spellcaster reaches Level 10, the damage increases by another d6|Acid Acid|1d6 Acid damage, for a total of 3d6|Acid.
notes: * In BG3, this cantrip is the only direct offensive area of effect option without the expenditure of resources that can be done on a per turn basis

name: Activate Call Lightning
summary: This spell allows spellcasters to call down lightning again to hit all targets within range. Can only be obtained while you are concentrating on Call Lightning.
description: Call down lightning to hit all targets within range and its area of effect for 3d10|Lightning damage.

name: Aid
summary: This spell allows spellcasters to heal and embolden their allies and themselves with resolve. Affected creatures have their maximum Hit Points increased for the duration of the spell.
description: Bolster your allies with toughness and resolve to heal and increase their Hit Points maximum.
higherLevels: Upcast: Casting this spell at a higher level increases the target's maximum health by an additional 5|Healing for each Spell Slot Level above 2nd.
notes:
* Downed allies return back to the fight and heal an additional 1 hit point.
* Granted by:
**Khalid's Gift (Khalid's Gift: Aid) at Lv3 equivalent 
**Shield of Devotion (Shield of Devotion: Aid) at Lv3
**Absolute's Talisman at Lv2
* Long Rest
* When granted from an item, it only affects the wearer.

name: An Apple a Day
summary: Summon Zlorb to aid you in battle.
description:
Summon Zlorb - a shapeshifting monstrosity that can adopt the aspect of several monsters and beasts.

The caster can only use this feature once in their adventure.

name: Animal Friendship
summary: This spell charms a beast and convinces it you mean no harm.
description:
Convince a beast not to attack you.

The creature must have an Intelligence of 3 or less.
Condition ends early if you or an ally hurts the target.
In higher difficulty modes, the target might become hostile when the spell ends.
higherLevels: Upcast: Affects an additional target for each Spell Slot Level above 1st.

name: Animate Dead
summary: This spell allows spellcasters to animate a corpse to create an undead servant.
description:
Animate a corpse to create an undead servant while not in combat.

The target must be a Medium or Small corpse.
notes:
* Patch 3 introduced a bug where skeletons summoned by this spell do not have weapons.
* Warlocks with the Pact of the Tome Pact Boon can cast this spell once per Long Rest once they receive Deepened Pact at level 5.
* It is important to note that most friendly and neutral NPCs will respond to undead minions with horror, causing them to express alarm and flee from proximity of the thralls, in some cases to their death. To avoid this, selecting the chain icon next to the summoner player and leaving the thrall at some distance before interacting with certain vendors or achievement related NPCs is advised.
* Casting with a level 4 spellslot allows to raise 3 minions instead of 1.
* Casting with a level 5 spellslot allows to raise a ghoul or a flying ghoul.
* These Summoned Undead do not have weapons so are not affected by Aura of Hate from Oathbreaker Paladin

name: Animus Screech
summary: Screech into your target's soul, wounding them and possibly inflicting Confused_(Condition)
description: Animus Screech is an ability of some undead, including Tormented Soul and Poltergeist

name: Arcane Gate
description:
Create two linked teleportation portals within range. All creatures, including enemies, may travel between the two portals as a free action.

The game's pathfinding will automatically navigate through a portal if it is the shorter route.

name: Arcane Lock
summary: This spell allows spellcasters to magically lock a container.
description: * Close a door or container with a magical lock. It can no longer be lockpicked or opened with Knock.

name: Armour of Agathys
summary: It allows spellcasters to create a spectral armour of frost that covers the caster and their equipment. The armour provides additional Hit Points to the caster and damages hostile targets while the added Hit Points are present.
description:
Gain 5 and deal 5|Cold Cold|damage to any creature that hits you with a melee attack.

Can only have Temporary Hit Points from one source.

name: Arms of Hadar
summary: This spell allows the caster to summon dark tendrils and deal Necrotic damage to enemies in an area centered on the caster, preventing them from taking reactions.
description:
Prevent targets from using reactions. 

On Save: Targets still take half damage but are able to use reactions.
higherLevels: Upcast: Deals an additional 1d6|Necrotic damage per level.

name: Balm of the Moonmaiden
summary: This spell allows spellcasters to heal several of their allies.
description:
Call upon Isobel to offer a furtive prayer to Selûne, healing up to 6 nearby allies.

The caster can only use this feature once in their adventure.

name: Bane
summary: This spell allows the caster to temporarily curse enemies, making their attacks miss more often and weakening their Saving Throws.
description: Up to 3 creatures receive a d4|Physical -1d4 penalty to Attack Rolls and SavingThrows.
higherLevels: Upcast: Affects an additional target for each Spell Slot Level above 1st.

name: Banishing Smite (Melee)
summary: This spells allows spellcasters to imbue their weapon with power, dealing force damage and possibly Banished|Banishing the target.
description:
Possibly Banished|Banish your target to another plane of existence.

Targets with 50 Hit Points or more can't be Banished.
notes:
* This spell can only be learned by Bards via Magical Secrets at level 10, as Paladins do not get access to level 5 spells until level 17 in D&D 5e.
*The spell is used similar to Divine Smite where you select it before a weapon attack, then if you miss the attack the spell slot is not expended. Unlike Divine Smite there is no reaction in the UI for it. If the target is reduced to 1-49 Hit Points it is then Banished for 2 turns.
*There is no save allowed for any aspect of this spell.
*If the weapon attack roll is a critical, then it does 10d10|Force damage.
*Can be upranked, but there is no additional benefit for doing so.

name: Banishing Smite (Ranged)
summary: This spells allows spellcasters to imbue their weapon with power, dealing force damage and possibly Banished|Banishing the target.
description:
Possibly Banished|Banish your target to another plane of existence.

Targets with 50 Hit Points or more can't be Banished.
notes:
* This spell can only be learned by Bards via Magical Secrets at level 10, as Paladins do not get access to level 5 spells until level 17 in D&D 5e.
*The spell is used similar to Divine Smite where you select it before a weapon attack, then if you miss the attack the spell slot is not expended. Unlike Divine Smite there is no reaction in the UI for it. If the target is reduced to 1-49 Hit Points it is then Banished for 2 turns.
*There is no save allowed for any aspect of this spell.
*If the weapon attack roll is a critical, then it does 10d10|Force damage.
*Can be upranked, but there is no additional benefit for doing so.

name: Banishment
summary: This spell allows spellcasters to temporarily send a target to another plane of existence.
description: Temporarily Banished|Banish your target to another plane of existence.
higherLevels: Upcast: Affect an additional target per level.

name: Barkskin
summary: This spell allows spellcasters to fortify the defense of a willing creature and increase their Armour Class. While under the effect of this spell, the target's skin has a bark-like texture.
description: Touch a willing creature to toughen its skin and increase its Armour Class up to 16.
notes: * While similar to Mage Armour, Barkskin doesn't modify the base armour class, it instead sets the total armour class to 16 if it would have been lower.

name: Action EndGameAlly OwlbearCubSummon
summary: Summon Armoured Owlbear to aid you in battle.
description:
Summon your owlbear cub - all grown up and ready to rage - in full armour.

Dismissed after combat until re-summoned.

Can't be summoned again if killed in combat.

name: Beacon of Hope
summary: This spell allows spellcasters to bolster their allies with hope and vitality.
description: Your allies will regain the maximum Hit Points possible when healed. They also gain Advantage on Wisdom SavingThrows and Death Saving Throws.
notes: * This spell also affects the caster despite the description only mentioning allies.

name: Beckoning Darkness
summary: This spell curses a creature to take Necrotic damage if it enters or starts its turn in a Lightly or Heavily Obscured area.
description: Curse a creature to be haunted by darkness. It takes 2d8|Necrotic damage if it enters or starts its turn in a Lightly or Heavily Obscured area.
notes: * Granted by Dark Justiciar Gauntlets Icon Dark Justiciar Gauntlets (Rare) using Strength as the Spellcasting Ability. Per turn

name: Bestow Curse
summary: This spell allows spellcasters to curse a target with their touch.
description:
Curse a creature with your touch. The curse either bestows Disadvantage on Checks and SavingThrows, Disadvantage on Attack Rolls, lets you deal additional damage to the target, or robs it of its Actions.

The effect of the curse is based on the variant selected, and lasts for 10 turns.
higherLevels: Upcast: The duration is increased by 10 turns for each Spell Slot Level above 3rd.
notes: * Also granted to Warlocks who choose the Eldritch Invocation Sign of Ill Omen at level 5+.

name: Blade Barrier
summary: This spell allows spellcasters to summon a wall of cutting blades.
description: Summons a wall of razor-sharp blades that turns the area into Difficult Terrain and damages anyone foolish enough to come close.

name: Blade Ward
summary: It allows spellcasters to become more resilient against physical damage.
description: Take only half the damage from Bludgeoning, Piercing, and Slashing attacks.

name: Bless
summary: This spell allows spellcasters to temporarily bolster themselves and their allies’ attacks and Saving Throws.
description: Bless up to 3 creatures. They gain a d4|Slashing +1d4 bonus to Attack Rolls and SavingThrows.
higherLevels: Upcast: Affects an additional target for each Spell Slot Level above 1st.

name: Blight
summary: This spell allows spellcasters to drain the moisture and vitality from a target creature using necromantic energy. It's especially effective versus plants.
description:
Deals 8d8|Necrotic to a target. Plants take maximum damage from this spell, and have Disadvantage on the SavingThrow against it.

On Save: Target still takes half damage.

No effect on undead and constructs.
higherLevels: Upcast: Casting this spell at a higher level deals an extra 1d8|Necrotic damage for each Spell Slot Level above 4th.
notes:
* Circle of the Lands who choose the Coast Land at level 7 learn this spell automatically.
* Granted by Woe. Long Rest
* The description given is not entirely correct in how the spell functions:
** When the target of this spell succeeds in their saving throw, they still take half damage, regardless if they are considered plants or not

name: Blinding Smite
description: Evoke a heavenly flare and possibly Blind your target

name: Blindness
summary: This spell allows spellcasters to magically Blinded|Blind a targeted hostile creature.
description:
Limit a foe's sight range. It is easier to hit, and the creature will miss more often.

Attack Rolls against it have Advantage and the foe attacks with Disadvantage.
higherLevels: Upcast: Affects an additional target for each Spell Slot Level above 2nd.

name: Blink
summary: This spell allows the spellcaster to travel to the Ethereal Plane, becoming temporarily unassailable and unseen until they return.
description:
Available only in combat.

At the end of your turn, roll a  d20. On 11 or higher, you vanish into the Ethereal Plane. While there, you can't be harmed or seen in this world. 

When you do vanish, your presence here is a representation of the location you'll come back to. You can choose to teleport it up to m=6|ft=20.

name: Bludgeon the Weak
summary: This spell is a variant of Brand the Weak that imposes vulnerability on an enemy to Bludgeoning damage.
description:
Make an enemy Vulnerable to Bludgeoning damage.

This effect lasts 3 turns, or until the target takes damage.

name: Blur
summary: This spell Blurs the spellcaster's body and makes them harder to hit.
description:
Your body becomes Blurred. Attackers have Disadvantage on Attack Rolls against you.

Doesn't affect creatures that don't rely on sight or that can see through illusions.
notes: * Granted by Shifting Corpus Ring. Long Rest

name: Bolts of Doom
summary: Bolts of Doom is a unique Level 4 Evocation Spell and a variant of Kereska's Favour that allows its caster to imbue themselves with the power of lightning and unlock resistances and spells associated with it. It is granted by Markoheshkir.
description:
Embrace Kereska's lightning bolts to gain Resistance to Lightning damage. Your lightning spells deal additional Lightning damage equal to your Proficiency Bonus.


When you deal spell damage, gain 2 Lightning Charges. While attuned to Kereska's lightning you can cast Chain Lightning and Lightning Bolt.

name: Bone Chill
summary: It deals Necrotic damage and prevents the target from regaining Hit Points.
description: Prevent the target from healing until your next turn. An undead target receives Disadvantage on Attack Rolls.
higherLevels:
When the spellcaster reaches Level 5, the damage increases by another d8|Necrotic Necrotic|1d8 Necrotic damage, for a total of 2d8|Necrotic.
When the spellcaster reaches Level 10, the damage increases by another d8|Necrotic Necrotic|1d8 Necrotic damage, for a total of 3d8|Necrotic.

name: Bone-shaking Thunder
summary: Bone-shaking Thunder is a unique Level 4 Evocation Spell and a variant of Kereska's Favour that allows its caster to imbue themselves with the power of thunder and unlock resistances and spells associated with it. It is granted by Markoheshkir.
description:
Embrace Kereska's thunder to gain Resistance to Thunder damage. Your thunder spells deal additional Thunder damage equal to your Proficiency Bonus.


When you deal spell damage, inflict 1 turn of Reverberation upon the target. While attuned to Kereska's thunder you can cast Shatter and Destructive Wave.

name: Brand the Weak
summary: This spell imposes vulnerability on an enemy to Bludgeoning, Slashing, or Piercing damage.
description:
Expose the weak points of an enemy. They become Vulnerable to Bludgeoning, Slashing, or Piercing damage.

This effect lasts 3 turns, or until the target takes damage.

name: Branding Smite
summary: This spell allows spellcasters to cause their weapon to gleam with astral radiance, allow them to mark targets with light, preventing them from turning Invisible
description:
Your weapon gleams with astral radiance as you strike and possibly mark your targets with light, preventing it from turning Invisible. 

* If the spellcaster misses the initial Attack, the spell slot and bonus are not consumed. This spell, unlike other Smite Spells, will work with Ranged weaponry.

name: Burning Age
summary: This spell is a variant of Elemental Age and imbues a weapon with fiery might, granting it bonus Fire|Fire damage and giving it an Attack Roll bonus.
description:
Gain a +1 bonus to Attack Rolls, and deals an additional 1d4|Fire damage.

The blade can be unequipped and equipped again, but has to stay on the spellcaster's person

name: Burning Hands
summary: It allows spellcasters to shoot a flaming cone from their fingertips and deal Fire damage to enemies.
description:
Each flammable target is hit with 3d6|Fire Fire|damage.

On Save: Targets still take half damage.
higherLevels: Upcast: Deals an additional Fire|1d6 Fire damage per level.
notes: * Draconic Bloodline of Red (Fire) Ancestry learns this spell automatically.

name: Call Lightning
summary: This spell allows spellcasters to call down lightning to hit all targets within range. The spellcaster can also continue to call down lightning repeatedly on subsequent turns.
description: Call down lightning to hit all targets within range and its area of effect for 3d10|Lightning damage.
higherLevels: Upcast: When the spell is cast using a 4th level spell slot or higher, damage increases by 1d10|Lightning for each Spell Slot Level above 3rd.

name: Calm Emotions
summary: This spell allows spellcasters to magically subdue intense emotions in targeted creatures. The affected target becomes neutral to the creatures it is hostile toward. It also cannot be Charmed or Frightened during the duration of the spell.
description: Humanoids can't be Charmed, Frightened, or become enraged.
notes: * When used on targets who are already Charmed, Frightened, or Enraged, this spell will end those mind-affecting conditions immediately.

name: Celestial Haste
summary: Provided by equipping Gontr Mael, it allows the wielder to Hasten themselves for 5 turns without suffering the Lethargic condition when it ends.
description: Gain Celestial Haste|Hastened.

name: Chain Lightning
description: Strike an enemy with lightning. Three more bolts will leap from the target, electrifying as many as three other enemies within range.

name: Charm Person
summary: This spell allows spellcasters to temporarily charm a humanoid creature, granting Advantage on Charisma Checks.
description:
Charm a humanoid to prevent it from attacking you. You gain Advantage on Charisma Checks in dialogue.

Enemies have Advantage on SavingThrows against being Charmed.

Condition ends early if you or an ally hurts the target.
In higher difficulty modes, the target might accuse you of enchanting them.
higherLevels: Upcast: Affect an additional target for each Spell Slot Level above 1st.

name: Chromatic Orb
summary: This spell allows spellcasters to fire a ball of energy and deal the desired damage type to enemies.
description:
Hurl a sphere of energy.

It deals 3d8|Thunder damage, or 2d8 Acid, Cold, Fire, Lightning or Poison damage and creates a surface.
higherLevels: * Upcast: Casting this spell at a higher level deals an extra d8|Physical 1d8 damage of the chosen type for each Spell Slot Level above 1st.
notes: * Also granted to Warlocks who choose the Book of Ancient Secrets}} at level 7+. When gained in this way, the spell can be cast once per [[Long Rest and doesn't expend Spell Slots.

name: Circle of Death
description: Sculpt a massive sphere of entropic energy around a creature. Devastate the target and all surrounding creatures.

name: Cloud of Daggers
summary: This spell allows spellcasters to conjure a barrage of daggers in an area that deal Slashing damage to any creature entering or starting their turn in the area.
description: Conjure a cloud of spinning daggers that attack anyone inside.
higherLevels: Upcast: Casting this spell at a higher level deals an extra 2d4|Slashing damage for each Spell Slot Level above 2nd.

name: Cloudkill
summary: This spell allows spellcasters to conjure a moveable cloud that damages and obscures everything it envelops.
description: Craft a large cloud that inflicts 5d8|Poison damage per turn. You can reposition the cloud every turn. The cloud Heavily Obscures everything within it.
notes: * Circle of the Lands who choose the Swamp or Underdark Land at level 9 learn this spell automatically.

name: Colour Spray
summary: This spell allows spellcasters to temporarily blind enemies with flashing coloured light, making their attacks miss more often and shortening their attack range.
description: Blinded|Blind creatures up to a combined Healing|33 Hit Points.
higherLevels: Upcast: Casting this spell at a higher level increases the number of targets by 1 and total Spell Slot Level above 1st.

name: Command
summary: This spell allows spellcasters to order their target to flee, move closer, freeze, drop to the ground, or drop their weapon.
description: Command a creature to flee, move closer, freeze, drop to the ground or drop its weapon. The target must succeed on a Wisdom in order to resist the effects.
higherLevels: Upcast: Affects an additional target for each Spell Slot Level above 1st.

name: Compelled Duel
summary: This spell allows spellcasters to compel an enemy to ignore other targets and attack only the spellcaster.
description: Force an enemy to attack only you, giving it Disadvantage against other targets.
higherLevels: Upcast: Casting this spell at a higher level doesn't grant any additional benefits.

name: Cone of Cold
summary: This spell allows spellcasters to blast icy air into a region in front of them, damaging affected creatures and turning existing water surfaces into Ice Surface.
description: Make a flurry of frost, crisp air, and condensed snow crystals erupt from your hands.
higherLevels: Upcast: The damage is increased by 1d8|Cold for each Spell Slot Level above 5th.

name: Confusion
summary: This spell allows spellcaster to confuse a group of creatures, drastically reducing their effectiveness in combat.
description: Befuddle a group of creatures, causing them to attack at random, wander around aimlessly, and occasionally skip turns in the stupor.
higherLevels: Upcast: Affects a larger area at higher levels.
notes:
* Circle of the Lands who choose the Coast Land at level 7 learn this spell automatically.
* Also granted to Warlocks who choose the Eldritch Invocation Dreadful Word at level 7+.

name: Conjure Barrage
summary: This spell allows spellcasters to summon a barrage of blades in front of them, potentially hitting multiple enemies.
description:
Channel your weapon's essence into a destructive, widespread volley. Deal Physical|Weapon Damage, plus an additional d8|Physical 2d8 damage of the same Type to enemies within a cone in front of you. This spell can be cast with either your melee weapon or ranged weapon.

On a successful Dexterity SavingThrow, targets still take half damage.

name: Conjure Elemental
summary: This spell allows spellcasters to summon a Fire, Earth, Water, or Air Elemental.
description: Bend the barrier between the Planes until they disgorge an elemental ally to follow and fight for you.
higherLevels: At level 6, the spellcaster can summon an Air Myrmidon, Earth Myrmidon, Fire Myrmidon, or Water Myrmidon.
notes:
* Circle of the Lands who choose the Coast or Mountain Land at level 9 learn this spell automatically.
* Also granted to Warlocks who choose the Eldritch Invocation Minions of Chaos at level 9+.

name: Conjure Minor Elemental
summary: Conjure 2 Mud Mephits, 2 Ice Mephites, or an Azer to fight for you.
description: Conjure a minor elemental to fight alongside you.
notes: * Circle of the Lands who choose the Arctic or Forest Land at level 7 learn this spell automatically.

name: Conjure Shadow Lantern Wraith
summary: Summon a Shadow to fight by your side.
description: Pull an undead creature from the depths of the Shadow Lantern's depraved magic to join your side in combat.
notes:
* The ingame tooltip states 'The target must be a Medium or Small corpse,' but a corpse is not required. The spell conjures a Shadow from within the lantern.
* Does not consume a spell slot, only an action. May only be cast once per Long Rest.

name: Conjure Woodland Being
summary: This spell summons a Dryad to fight alongside the caster.
description:
Conjure a Dryad to fight alongside you.
She can use Nature's Step, Entangle enemies, and summon a Fallen Lover|Wood Woad.

name: Contagion
summary: This spell allows spellcasters to infect their target with an affliction of their choosing, potentially resulting in the target contracting a disease.
description:
Poison a target and possibly afflict them with a disease of your choice.

Once infected, the target will roll a Constitution SavingThrow each turn. If it accumulates 3 successes, it recovers. If it accumulates 3 failures, it contracts the Disease chosen by the spellcaster.

Diseases:
* Contagion: Filth Fever|w=40
* Contagion: Flesh Rot|w=40
* Contagion: Slimy Doom|w=40
* Contagion: Seizure|w=40
* Contagion: Mindfire|w=40
* Contagion: Blinding Sickness|w=40
notes: * Circle of the Lands who choose the Arctic, Forest, or Underdark Land at level 9 learn this spell automatically.

name: Corrosive Age
summary: This spell is a variant of Elemental Age and imbues a weapon with corrosive might, granting it bonus Acid|Acid damage and giving it an Attack Roll bonus.
description:
Gain a +1 bonus to Attack Rolls, and deals an additional 1d4|Acid damage.

The blade can be unequipped and equipped again, but has to stay on the spellcaster's person

name: Counterspell
summary: This spell allows spellcasters to interrupt another caster's spellcasting, causing it to fail and have no effect.
description: Nullify another creature's spell as a reaction. The spell must be 3rd Level or lower. If it is higher, you must succeed a Check to nullify it, the difficulty of which is based on the spell's Level.
notes:
*Granted by Staff of Interruption
*Even a failed Counterspell will feed the Abjuration Arcane Ward.
* In 5e, an upcast Counterspell will automatically counter a spell if the spellslot level matches or exceeds the to-be-countered spell. Couterspelling a spell of a higher spellslot level requires the counterspelling caster to make an ability check, with a DC of 10 + (Level of to-be-countered spell). The spellcasting ability is added to the d20 roll of the counterspelling caster.
** It is not certain at this time if this mechanic was identically implemented in BG3.

name: Create or Destroy Water
summary: This spell allows spellcasters to conjure or destroy an area of water (or water-like surfaces).
description: Choose to call forth rain or destroy a water-based surface.
higherLevels: Upcast: When the spell is cast a 2nd Level or higher, the area that you can create or destroy water increases by 2m / 5ft for each Spell Slot Level above 1st.
notes:
*Create water applies the Wet condition: Vulnerability to Cold and Lightning damage (double damage).
*Lightning Spells cast on water causes the Shocked condition: Removing their reaction and having a chance to stun. 
*Electrified Water + a Fire Spell causes Electrified Steam, which resets the Shocked and Wet conditions.
*A Cold spell freezes the water/mist and creates an Ice Surface, causing Difficult Terrain (half Movement Speed) and may cause creatures in the area to fall prone status effect Prone unless succeeding a DEX Save. (e.g. Create Water + Glyph of Warding).

name: Create Sorcery Points
summary: Create Sorcery Points is a Level 2 Sorcerer Bonus Action. This ability allows Sorcerers to transform arcane magic into their innate sorcery powers.
description: Spend Spell Slots to gain Sorcery Points. The level of spell slot spent creates the equivalent number in sp|forceplural=yes

name: Create Undead
description: Create a corpse as a heinous mummy that fights by your side.
notes: * Also granted by Crypt Lord Ring. Long Rest

name: Create Water
summary: This spell is a variant of Create or Destroy Water that allows spellcasters to conjure an area of water that rain from thin air and forms a water surface. Creatures standing in the area when the spell is cast will become Wet.
description: Call forth rain. It extinguishes exposed flames and forms a Water Surface.
higherLevels: Upcast: When the spell is cast a 2nd Level or higher, the area that you can create water increases by 2m / 5ft for each Spell Slot Level above 1st.

name: Crown of Madness
summary: This spell allows spellcasters to temporarily charm a humanoid creature and induce madness in their mind. The affected creature will make a melee attack against any creature within its reach.
description: Instill madness in a humanoid enemy, making them attack the creature closest to them (other than you), even if it's allied.

name: Crusader's Mantle
summary: This spell allows spellcasters to imbue their allies' weapons with holy power, causing them to deal additional Radiant damage.
description: Radiate a holy power that emboldens nearby allies. Their weapon attacks deal an additional 1d4|Radiant damage.
notes: * Also granted by Mantle of the Holy Warrior. Short Rest

name: Cure Wounds
summary: This spell allows spellcasters to heal allies with divine magic through touch.
description:
Healing|Heal a creature you can touch.

No effect on undead and constructs.
higherLevels: Upcast: Heals an additional 1d8|Healing for each Spell Slot Level above 1st.

name: Curriculum of Strategy: Artistry of War
summary: Fires multiple projectiles that deal Force damage. Can only be cast once per short rest.
description: Summon the apparitions of 6 master strategists. Each apparition strikes a target of your choosing, dealing 2d6 + 6|Force damage (for a total of 12d6 + 36|Force).
higherLevels: Can't be cast in a higher spell slot.

name: Dancing Lights
summary: It creates magical orbs of light that brighten an area.
description: Illuminate a m=9|ft=30 radius.

name: Danse Macabre
summary: Danse Macabre is a 5th level Necromancy spell that summons 4 uncontrollable Ghouls to fight for you.
description: Create 4 ghouls that fight alongside you.

name: Darkness
summary: This spell allows spellcasters to conjure a cloud of darkness in an area within range that obscures and Blinded|blinds those within it.
description: Create a cloud of magical darkness that Heavily Obscured|Heavily Obscures and Blinded|Blinds creatures within. Creatures cannot make ranged attacks into or out of it.
higherLevels: Upcast: Casting this spell at a higher level doesn't grant any additional benefits.
notes:

If the initial attack would have 3 applications then the creature would be Downed] on 1st attack and again on 3rd attack. notes:
* Flame strike is often compared with Fireball:
** When cast with a level 5 spellslot, both deal 10d6 damage total, though Flame Strike has a slight advantage in general due to the mixed damage type it has. Fire damage is often resisted and radiant damage is often not.
** Relatedly, Flame Strike imparts two separate instances of damage for the affect targets, once radiant, once fire. This has many mechanical benefits, but the main one is that it forces all targets who are concentrating to each roll a Concentration Saving Throw twice.
** Fireball requires a direct trajectory between the caster and the target for the fireball to travel, Flame Strike can be used within range as long as the caster has sight on the target location.
** Fireball has a 33% larger radius of effect when compared to Flame Strike
* In 5e, Flame Strike deals 2d6 less damage than a level 5 fireball, while having half the effect radius.

higherLevels: See each individual variant's page.
notes:
* When the glyph is triggered, those affected by it each rolls a  Dexterity SavingThrow. If a creature successfully saves, they only take half the damage for the damaging variants of this spell, and suffers no ill effect for the non-damaging variants.
* Only those considered an enemy can trigger the glyph, for the player's party this is indicated via a red circle beneath the creature, red outlines when highlighted, and denoted by a red dot in the minimap. Neutral, friendly, and allied creatures (highlighted yellow/green/blue respectively) can safely go through the glyph.
** This makes using the glyph as a trap difficult for many encounters. Specifically, those that normally only consider creatures hostile after dialogue.
* If the glyph is cast in an area where hostile creatures are already present, it triggers immediately.
* When the glyph is triggered everyone within the area is affected, regardless of allegiance.
* When the spellcaster is surrounded by enemies, sometimes it is worth throwing the glyph down right at their feet. This is true for most AOE spells but it is especially so for the sleep variant of Glyph of Warding:
** The shared Initiative system means an ally can immediately shove/help the spellcaster awake should they fall asleep due to their own glyph.
** Magical Sleep Immunity is fairly common, either from an Elixir of Peerless Focus or from Fey Ancestry
*** Shadowheart, being a Half-Elf Cleric, can naturally utilize this tactic starting from level 5.

description: Touch a creature and negate any Charmed|Charm, Petrified|Petrification, Stunned|Stun, or cursed.
notes: * Circle of the Lands who choose the Coast or Grassland Land at level 9 learn this spell automatically.

name: Guardian of Faith
summary: This spell allows spellcasters to summon a divine guardian who sacrifices its Hit Points to damage enemies.
description: Call forth a divine guardian that attacks nearby enemies. Every time it deals damage, the guardian loses an equal amount of Hit Points. Lasts 10 turns. The guardian is stationary. When an enemy is in range, it uses an attack called "Strike of the Guardian". It has a range of 3m and deals 20 Radiant damage. On a DEX save, enemies still take half damage. It has 60 Hit Points.

name: Guidance

The target gains d4|Physical +1d4 bonus to Ability Checks.

10

description: The next Attack Roll against this target has Advantage.

summary: Summon Lady Coup and Lady Lockjaw to aid you in battle.
description:
Summon two elite assassasin mercenaries from the Guild's ranks.

Dismissed after combat until re-summoned.

Can't be summoned again if killed in combat.

name: Gur Huntwardens
summary: Summon two Gur Hunter Warriors and a Gur Hunter Sharpshooter.
description:
Summon Gur Monster hunters to hinder enemies while slipping in and out of the frontlines.

Dismissed after combat until re-summoned.

Can't be summoned again if killed in combat.

name: Gust of Wind
summary: This spell allows spellcasters to conjure a squall to clear dangerous gasses or throw creatures back, potentially causing a dangerous fall.
description: Summon a strong wind that clears all clouds. Any creatures caught in the gale who fail a Strength SavingThrow will be pushed back ft=17 and be thrown Off Balance.
higherLevels: Upcast: Casting this spell at a higher level doesn't grant any additional benefits.
notes:
* Granted by Amulet of Windrider. Short Rest
* A successful SavingThrow means that a creature is neither pushed back, nor goes Off Balance

name: Hail of Thorns
summary: This spell allows spellcasters to make ranged attacks and potentially deal AoE Piercing damage to enemies.
description: Shoot a volley of thorns. They deal weapon damage|Physical and explode, dealing an additional 1d10|Piercing damage to the target and surrounding creatures.
higherLevels:
* When the spell is cast at 2nd Level or higher, the addition AoE damage increases by 1d10|Piercing for each spell slot level above 1st.

* When the spell is cast at 3rd Level or higher, it will no longer consume a Bonus Action.

name: Harm
summary: This spell allows spellcasters to make an enemy much more feeble.
description:
Reduce a target's maximum Hit Points, but never below 1.

On Save: Target still takes half damage, but its maximum Hit Points are not reduced.

name: Haste
summary: This spell allows spellcasters to allow their allies to become Hastened.
description:
Target yourself or an ally to become Hastened. The creature has a +2 bonus to Armour Class, Advantage on Dexterity SavingThrows, its Movement Speed is doubled, and can take one additional Action per turn. 

When the condition ends, the creature becomes Lethargic.
notes:
* Circle of the Lands who choose the Arctic or Grassland Land at level 5 learn this spell automatically.
* Warlocks with the Pact of the Tome Pact Boon can cast this spell once per Long Rest once they receive Deepened Pact at level 5.
* Granted by Darkfire Shortbow. Long Rest
* A shorter version of Haste called Celestial Haste is granted by Gontr Mael. Long Rest

name: Heal
summary: This spell allows spellcasters to substantially heal a target by recovering Hit Points and removing Diseases.
description:
Heals a target's wounds and remove Blindness and any Diseases.

No effect on undead and constructs.

name: Healing Word
summary: This spell allows spellcasters to heal allies that they can see within range.
description:
Healing|Heal a creature you can see.

No effect on undead and constructs.
higherLevels: Upcast: Heals an additional 1d4|Healing for each Spell Slot Level above 1st.

name: Heat Metal
summary: This spell allows spellcasters to heat up a metal weapon or armour on the targeted creature, forcing them to let go or receive damage or suffer various penalties.
description:
Cause a metal Weapon or Ability Checks. If the creature is only wearing metal armour, it always receives Disadvantage. 

If the creature is still touching the metal, you can use a Bonus Action on subsequent turns to Reapply Heat Metal to deal another 2d8|Fire damage and force the creature to let go or receive Disadvantage.
higherLevels: Upcast: Casting this spell at a higher level deals an extra 1d8|Fire damage for each Spell Slot Level above 2nd.
notes: *The bonus action cast provided by the Heat Metal condition receives the same upcasting damage bonus as the main cast.

name: Hellfire Orb
summary: This spell allows spellcasters to unleash a streak of fire from their hands that ignites into a large explosion at a chosen point within range.
description:
Hurl an exploding ball of hellfire that damages all nearby creatures and objects.

Hellfire burns with more fervour than any mortal flame, ignoring Immunity to Fire damage.

name: Hellish Rebuke
summary: This spell allows spellcasters to surround a creature in hellfire that deals Fire damage as a Reaction when taking damage from them.
description:
React to your next attacker with flames that deal 2d10|Fire damage. 

On Save: Target still takes half damage.
higherLevels: Upcast: Deals an additional 1d10|Fire damage per level.

name: Hellrider Platoon
summary: Summon the Hellrider Paladin, Hellrider Cleric alongside with Zevlor.
description:
Summon Zevlor's Hellriders to Smite foes and support frontline allies.

Dismissed after combat until re-summoned.

Can't be summoned again if killed in combat.

name: Hellstalker Yurgir
summary: Summon Hellstalker Yurgir to aid you in battle.
description:
Summon Yurgir the orthon - a deadly combatant at range or in melee who can become Invisible immediately after attacking.


Dismissed after combat until re-summoned.

Can't be summoned again if killed in combat.

name: Heroes' Feast
summary: This spell allows spellcasters to summon a bountiful smorgasbord to bolster themselves and their allies and strengthen their resolve.
description: You and everyone around can't be Poisoned, Diseased, or Frightened. Everyone's maximum Hit Points increases by 12, and they make Wisdom SavingThrows with Advantage.
notes:
* Creates a temporary Feast Supplies container for 10 turns that contains 46-58 Camp Supplies and 1 bottle of Water. The items will drop on the floor when the container expires.
* The buff from this spell will disappear if the caster unprepares the spell. This may be a bug as this does not happen with the similar spell Aid.

name: Heroism
summary: This spell allows spellcasters to instill themselves or an ally with courage. The affected creature cannot be Frightened and gains Temporary Hit Points.
description:
Make yourself or a target immune to Frightened and gain 5 Temporary Hit Points each turn.

Prerequisite Icon Can only have Temporary Hit Points from one source.
higherLevels: Upcast: Affects an additional target for each Spell Slot Level above 1st.

name: Hex
summary: This spell allows spellcasters to put a curse on a creature and deal additional Necrotic damage to the targeted creature. The curse also imposes Disadvantage on a chosen ability check.
description:
Make your attacks deal an additional 1d6|Necrotic Necrotic|damage damage [sic] to the target and give it Disadvantage on Checks on an Ability of your choosing.

If the target dies before the spell ends, you can Reapply Hex to a new creature without expending a Spell Slot.
notes:
* If the target dies before spell's duration ends, gain size=28|Reapply Hex Icon|Reapply Hex
* Hex damage is applied multiple times for multiple successful Attack Rolls. Example scenarios:
** Warlock hits the target with a melee or ranged weapon attack: additional 1d6|Necrotic.
** Level 1 Warlock casts Eldritch Blast and hits the target: additional 1d6|Necrotic.
** Level 5 Warlock casts Eldritch Blast and hits the target with both rays: additional 2d6|Necrotic, for hitting twice.
** Level 3 Warlock casts Scorching Ray and hits the target with all three rays: additional 3d6|Necrotic, for hitting three times.
** Level 5 Warlock casts Scorching Ray and hits the target with all four rays: additional 4d6|Necrotic, for hitting four times.
* Hex is only triggered by hitting the target with a successful Attack Roll, and not by other sources of damage. Example scenarios:
** Warlock casts Magic Missile (which does not require Attack Rolls): no additional damage from Hex.
** Warlock casts Fireball (which is a Saving Throw, not an Attack Roll): no additional damage from Hex.
* Clarification: The in-game description says it grants 'Disadvantage on an Ability of your choosing', but it only applies to Checks, not all rolls utilising that Ability: the target still rolls normally on Saving Throws and Attack rolls.
* In Early Access Patch 9, there was a bugged interaction between Hex and the Eldritch Invocation Agonising Blast, which caused Agonising Blast bonus damage to be applied an extra time for each instance of Hex damage.
** In the case of a level 5 Warlock with two Eldritch Blast beams, this means Agonising Blast damage would be applied a total of 4 times, if both beams hit: once for each beam, and once for each instance of Hex damage.

name: Hold Monster
summary: This spell allows spellcasters to Paralyse a creature, preventing them from acting and making them vulnerable to attacks.
description:
Paralysed|Paralyse a creature. It can't Move, Act, or React. Attacks from within m=3|ft=10 are always Critical Hits.
* No effect on undead.

name: Hold Person
summary: This spell allows spellcasters to hold a target humanoid in place. The affected creature is unable to move and act and is much more susceptible to attacks.
description:
Hold a humanoid enemy still. They can't Move, Act, or React. Attacks from within m=3|ft=10 are always Critical Hits.

At the end of each turn, the affected creature can make a Wisdom SavingThrow to end this condition.
higherLevels: Upcast: Affects an additional target for each Spell Slot Level above 2nd.

name: Hunger of Hadar
summary: It creates an area that deals damage and inflicts conditions to creatures in it, including reduced movement speed.

Creatures within this black sphere are Blinded and take damage at the end of their turn and the start of their turn.

Creatures starting their turn in the area take 2d6|Cold damage. Creatures ending their turn in the area possibly take 2d6|Acid damage.

The area is Difficult Terrain.

name: Hypnotic Pattern
summary: This spell allows spellcasters to hypnotise all creatures within an area.

Hypnotised|Hypnotise creatures that can see the pattern. They cannot attack you. They cannot move or act.

This spell can be cast while you are Silenced.
notes: * Circle of the Lands who choose the Desert Land at level 5 learn this spell automatically.

name: Ice Knife
summary: The caster throws a shard of ice, which explodes and leaves behind an icy surface.
description:
Throw a shard of ice that deals 1d10|Piercing damage. It explodes and deals 2d6|Cold damage to anyone nearby. It leaves an Ice Surface. On miss, the shard of ice still explodes.

This spell can be cast while you are Silenced.
higherLevels: Upcast: Casting this spell at a higher level deals an extra 1d6|Cold damage for each Spell Slot Level above 1st.
notes: * Creatures on an Prone}} on failing a [[Dexterity SavingThrow.

name: Ice Storm
summary: This spell allows spellcasters to summon an ice storm to strike an area.
description: Impel a storm of hail and ice to crash from the sky, covering the ground and striking all objects and creatures within range, dealing Bludgeoning and Cold damage. It also creates an Ice Surface that lasts 2 turns.
higherLevels: Upcast: Casting this spell at a higher level deals an extra 1d8|Bludgeoning damage for each Spell Slot Level above 4th.
notes: * Circle of the Lands who choose the Arctic Land at level 7 learn this spell automatically.

name: Inflict Wounds
summary: This spell allows the spellcaster to make a melee attack that inflicts Necrotic damage.
description: Putrefy a creature with Necrotic energy filling your hands.
higherLevels: Upcast: Deals an additional 1d10|Necrotic damage per level.

name: Insect Plague
summary: This spell allows spellcasters to create a damaging, debilitating swarm of insects over a section of the battlefield.
description: Locusts attack everyone within range, make the area Checks.
higherLevels: Upcast: Casting this spell at a higher level deals an extra 1d10|Piercing damage for each Spell Slot Level above 5th.

name: Invisibility
summary: This spell allows spellcasters to turn themselves and other creatures Invisible to the naked eye.
description:
Touch a creature to turn it Invisible. Attacks against it have Disadvantage. It attacks with Advantage.

Invisibility breaks when you fail Checks on attacking, casting spells, or interacting with items.Bug

Condition ends early if the creature attacks or casts a spell.
higherLevels: Upcast: Affects an additional target for each Spell Slot Level above 2nd.

name: Ironhand Grenadiers
summary: Summon 2 Ironhand Grenadiers, who can throw blinding bombs and shoot Smokepowder Arrows.
description:
Summon the Ironhand Gnomes to damage and debilitate with thrown grenades.

Dismissed after combat until re-summoned.

Can't be summoned again if killed in combat.

name: Karsus' Compulsion
summary:
Karsus' Compulsion is a Level 9 Enchantment Spell.nograd=1
Channel the stones' magic to control the Crown of Karsus.
notes:

* This is one of only three 9th Level spells featured in Baldur's Gate 3. verify The other two are:
** Wish, cast by Vlaakith at the end of Creche Y'llek if the player doubts her power.
** Power Word Kill, a special variant of which is cast by Farslayer of Bhaal Ghislev in the Undercity Ruins.
* Unlike Wish and Power Word Kill, Karsus' Compulsion was created specifically for Baldur's Gate 3.

name: Keeper's Fee
summary: It is uniquely known by Helsik.
description: Magically snatch a weapon from the target's hand.

name: Kereska's Favour
summary: It allows its caster to imbue themselves with an element and unlock resistances and spells associated with it. It is granted by Markoheshkir.
description: Imbue yourself with elemental energy sourced from the draconic goddess, Kereska.

name: Khalid's Gift: Aid
summary: This spell allows Khalid's Gift's wearer to heal themselves for 10|Healing and increase their hit points for the same amount.
description: Heal yourself and increase your hit point maximum by 10|Healing.

name: Kirh'raki Inferno
summary: Summon a upscaled version of Wall of Fire, with increased damage and aoe.
description:
Command the red dragon of Supreme Kith'rak Voss to breathe a wall of fire onto the battlefield.

The caster can only use this feature once in their adventure.

name: Knock
summary: This spell allows spellcasters to unlock non-magical locks.
description: Unlock an object that is held shut by a mundane lock.
notes:
* Knock can instantly open any non-magical lock regardless of its lockpicking difficulty
** Locks that resist Knock will have a status denoting so
* Granted by Knock Knuckle Gloves. Long Rest

name: Legacy of Avernus: Searing Smite
summary: This spell allows a *

Your weapon flares with white-hot intensity. It deals an extra  2d6| Fire damage and marks the target with Searing Smite.

* A target with Searing Smite takes 1d6|Fire damage every turn, until it succeeds on a Constitution SavingThrow.
* If the spellcaster misses the initial Attack, the spell slot and Bonus Action Icon|Bonus Action|size=24px are not consumed.

name: Lesser Restoration
summary: This spell allows the spellcaster to cure an adjacent creature.
description: Cure a creature from diseased, poisoned, Paralysed|Paralysis, or blinded.
notes: * Granted by Amulet of Silvanus. Long Rest

name: Light
summary: It makes an object shed light in a small area.
description: Infuse an object with an aura of light. Only affects one target at a time.
notes: * When cast on a character, it will apply the effect to their active weapon.

name: Lightning Bolt
summary: This spell allows spellcasters to discharge a bolt of lightning in any direction, potentially hitting multiple creatures.
description: Call forth a blast of lightning that hits all creatures in the line of the eruption.
higherLevels: Upcast: Casting this spell at a higher level deals an extra 1d6|Lightning for each Spell Slot Level above 3rd.
notes: * Circle of the Lands who choose the Mountain Land at level 5 learn this spell automatically.

name: Longstrider
summary: This spell allows spellcasters to make a creature move farther during a turn.
description: Increase a creature's Movement Speed by m=3|ft=10.
higherLevels: Upcast: Affect an additional target for each Spell Slot Level above 1st.

name: Lorroakan's Firestorm
summary: Summon a upscaled version of Fireball, with increased damage and aoe.
description:
Lorroakan uses all the arcane might of Ramazith's Tower to call down a fiery barrage. 
On a successful Saving Throw, targets still take half damage.

The caster can only use this feature once in their adventure.

name: Lovely Assistant
summary: When Malus Thorm's assistants are dead, he will use this Spell to reanimate them.
description:
The Surgeon reanimates the corpse of one of his nurses.

The target must be a Medium or Small corpse.

name: Mage Armour
summary: This spell allows unarmoured spellcasters to surround themselves with magical protection.
description:
Surround an unarmoured creature in a protective magical force. Its Armour Class increases to 13 + its Dexterity modifier.

Prerequisite: The target can't be wearing Armour.

name: Mage Hand
summary: It conjures a spectral hand that can interact with objects.
description:
Create a spectral hand that can manipulate and interact with objects.

Duration: 10 turns.

This cantrip can only be cast once per short rest.
notes: * Githyanki and Arcane Tricksters can cast a special version of Mage Hand that is invisible.

name: Magic Missile
summary: This spell allows spellcasters to hit enemies with multiple projectiles that deal Force damage.
description:
Create three darts of magical force, each dealing 1d4 + 1|Force damage to its target.

The darts always hit their target, and can each be targeted individually.
higherLevels: When the spell is cast at 2nd Level or higher, an additional dart is created for each Spell Slot Level above 1st.
notes:
* The Shield spell causes the caster to take no damage from Magic Missile.
* The level 10 Evocation feature Empowered Evocation will add the wizard's intelligence modifier to each missile.
* When interacting with effects like Death Ward and dealing multiple attacks to the same creature, if the 1st attack was sufficient to Downed|down the target, the 2nd attack will apply beforeDeath Ward activates leaving the target with 1HP. An action with three attacks, however, would result in the creature being downed. A player character with Death Ward applied would need to receive 6 attack applications to fully die: 2 to break the ward, 1 to get downed, then 3 more to fail 3 Death Saving Throws. This effect seems to apply to all multi-application attacks such Scorching Ray and Eldritch Blast (as of 4.1.1.3669438).

name: Magic Weapon
summary: This spell allows spellcasters to infuse a weapon with arcane energy, making it magical.
description: Infuse a weapon with arcane energy. The weapon becomes magical, receiving a +1 bonus to Attack Rolls and Damage Rolls.
higherLevels: Upcast: Casting this spell using a 4th or 5th level Spell Slot will increase the bonus by 2, and a 6th level Spell Slot will increase it by 3.
notes:
* The bonus to attack and damage from Magic Weapon does stack with inherent enchantments on weapons.
* This can only be applied to melee weapons.

name: Mammon's Tax
summary: Mammon's Tax is a Class Action known by Helsik. It deals 6d6 Slashing damage to a target for every 500 gold it has.
description: Rend the flesh of a greedy creature, dealing 6d6 Slashing damage for every 500 gold it has.

name: Mass Cure Wounds
summary: This spell allows spellcasters to heal several of their allies.
description:
Unleash a soothing hum of energy that heals you and nearby allies.

No effect on Undead and Constructs
higherLevels: Upcast: Casting this spell at a higher level deals an extra 1d8|Healing damage for each Spell Slot Level above 5th.

name: Mass Healing Word

description: Call out words of restoration to heal up to 6 creatures for 1d4 + Spellcasting Modifier|Healing.
higherLevels: When this spell is cast using a 4th level slot or higher, targets heal an extra 1d4|Healing for each Spell Slot Level above 3rd.

name: Melf's Acid Arrow
summary: This spell allows spellcasters to shoot a magical arrow that deals Acid|Acid damage to a target on impact and at the end of its next turn.
description:
Shoot a green arrow that bursts in a spray of acid. Deals 4d4|Acid damage immediately and 2d4|Acid damage at the end of the target's next turn.

If the spell misses, the target still takes half the initial damage, but no damage at the end of its next turn.
higherLevels: Upcast: Casting this spell at a higher level deals an extra 2d4|Acid damage (1d4|Acid on impact and at the end of target's turn) for each Spell Slot Level above 2nd.
notes: * Can be cast with Melf's First Staff once per Long Rest. The spell uses a caster's existing spellcasting ability modifier, or otherwise uses Charisma as its casting modifier for a character without a spellcasting ability modifier.

name: Mind Flayer Domination
summary: Mind Flayer Domination is an Action and Dominate a nearby humanoid.
description:
Dominate a nearby humanoid. Allies are unaffected.

Each time the dominated creature takes damage, it may repeat the SavingThrow against your domination.

name: Minor Illusion
summary: It conjures a simple illusion to distract creatures.
description:
Create an illusion that compels nearby creatures to investigate.

You can remain hidden while casting this spell.

This spell can be cast while you are Silenced.

Duration: 10 turns.
notes:
* Illusions can cast a special version of Minor Illusion as a Bonus Action.
* Outside of combat, causes most NPCs to walk towards the illusion and surround it.
* During combat, this causes enemies to turn towards the illusion.
* Springs traps if cast on top of the trap
* Placed on top of a vent it prevents gas from coming out
* Will disappear if you concentrate on another spell, but will not break concentration for existing spells

name: Mirror Image
summary: This spell allows spellcasters to create 3 illusory duplicates of themselves to distract attackers.

Whenever you successfully evade an attack, one of the duplicates disappears.

name: Netherese Orb Blast

* (Possible Bug) As of Patch 3, the target of this spell does not get to attempt to make saving throws on subsequent turns which makes it an irresistible 10 round crowd control ability.

name: Paralyzing Ray
summary: This spell Paralysed|paralyses its target.

notes: * Way of Shadows gain the ability to cast this spell at level 3, at the cost of ki|2.

name: Phantasmal Force

Until Long Rest

name: True Strike
summary: The caster gains Advantage on their next Attack Roll against the target.
description: Gain Advantage on your next Attack Roll.
notes:
* This cantrip is also granted to Rangers who pick Mage Breaker as their Favoured Enemy at level 1.
* The description of True Strike is among the more confusingly worded, and thus is prone to being misunderstood. To wit:
** Only the caster of this spell gains Advantage on their next attack against the affected target, never their allies.
** Only the first attack roll following the application of the condition gains Advantage. The condition is removed immediately afterward, whether the attack roll is a hit or a miss.
** The duration is 2 turns, but this includes the turn on which the condition is applied. This is true of many spells, but is especially important for short duration spells.
* True Strike is rarely considered worth using due to its opportunity cost; a full action must be spent on it to improve the chances of hitting once. Most of the time, if two actions are available (whether on the same turn or not), attacking twice is more effective than attacking once with advantage due to damage bonuses.
* However, True Strike is not considered aggressive, so the caster could cast it just before combat to gain its benefits without having to spend an action mid-fight. This eliminates the opportunity cost. Note that the duration is only 2 turns (12 seconds while not in turn-based mode).
* Another niche use case exists for an Arcane Trickster making a Sneak Attack (Melee)|Sneak Attack. If the caster is out of spell slots, and no allies can flank for a sneak attack, and there is no other way to gain advantage for an attack roll, spending a single action on True Strike to enable a single sneak attack can be considered efficient.
** In such cases, True Strike can be even more useful when using the Sneak Attack (Ranged)|ranged version of sneak attack, since this allows the caster to benefit from the range of the cantrip, especially with a High Ground bonus. At such distances, however, it is typically easier to just use a Bonus Action to hide first and obtain Advantage.

name: Tyr's Protection
summary:
This spell  allows spellcasters to surround themselves or an ally with divine protection and gain a bonus to their Armour Class.

This item spell is similar to the spell Shield of Faith.
description: Surround a creature with a shimmering field of magic that increases its Armour Class by 2. Spell ends when the Sword of Justice is unequipped.

name: Tyrant's Bindings
summary: This spell allows Gortash to restrict your movement and deal a ton of damage to you and your party.
description:
Create heavy magical chains that bind to your targets, halving their Movement speed.

If the chains are still present at the beginning of your next turn, they break, dealing 8d8|Force damage to all targets.

name: Vampiric Touch
summary: This spell allows spellcasters at melee range to siphon the life force of their target.
description:
Touch an enemy to siphon their life force and regain half as many Hit Points.

For 10 turns, you can use Vampiric Touch again without expending an additional Spell Slot.
higherLevels: Upcast: Casting this spell at a higher level deals an extra 1d6|Necrotic damage for each Spell Slot Level above 3rd.
notes: * Circle of the Lands who choose the Swamp Land at level 5 learn this spell automatically.

name: Veil of the Weird
summary: This spell allows the caster to cast Greater Invisibility up to five creatures.
description:
Channel Auntie Ethel's hag magic to render 5 creatures within range Invisible.

The caster can only use this feature once in their adventure.

name: Vicious Mockery
summary: It deals Psychic damage to enemies and inflicts Disadvantage on their Attack Rolls.
description: Insult a creature: it has Disadvantage on its next Attack Roll.
higherLevels:
When the spellcaster reaches Level 5, the damage increases to 2d4|Psychic.
When the spellcaster reaches Level 10, the damage increases to 3d4|Psychic.
notes: * Also granted to Warlocks who choose Pact of the Tome as their Pact Boon at level 3.

name: Wall of Fire
summary: This spell allows spellcasters to create a long, fiery barrier, damaging anything in the area.
description: Create a blazing wall of fire, Burning anyone who dares stand too close. Deals Fire to anything that moves into or starts it's turn in the area.
higherLevels: Upcast: Casting this spell at a higher level deals an extra 1d8|Fire damage for each Spell Slot Level above 4th.
notes:
* Circle of the Lands who choose the Desert Land at level 7 learn this spell automatically.
* This spell creates a wall from the first targeted point to the second targeted point, a distance of up to m=36|ft=120. The wall is m=3|ft=10 wide.

name: Wall of Ice
description: Raise a wall of solid ice that deals 10d6|Cold damage to anyone standing in its way. When the ice is broken, it leaves behind a cloud of frigid air that deals 10d6|Cold per turn to creatures within.

name: Wall of Stone
summary: This spell allows spellcasters to create a solid stone barrier.
description:
Raise a wall of non-magical, solid stone.

The wall can be created between any two points within range as long as there is a clear path between them.  It is made up of Stone Pillars with 30 HP each, immune to Psychic and vulnerable to Force and Thunder damage.  Pillars block movement and line of sight.

name: Wall of Thorns
summary: This spell allows spellcasters to conjure a wall of brambles, Entangling and damaging any creatures who are in the area, or trying to pass through.
description: Create a wall of pliable, twisting thorns surrounded by Entangling vines. Creatures can move through the wall, but take 7d8|Piercing damage per turn, their Movement Speed is halved due to Difficult Terrain, and they may become Entangled.
notes: * This spell creates a wall from the first targeted point to the second targeted point, a distance of up to m=36|ft=120. The wall is m=4|ft=13 wide.

name: Warden of Vitality
summary: This spell allows spellcasters to heal allies repeatedly with Restore Vitality using only Bonus Actions for 10 turns.
description: While this aura lasts, you can cast Restore Vitality as a bonus to heal yourself or nearby allies by 2d6|Healing.

name: Warding Bond
summary: This spell allows spellcasters to bolster an ally's defenses while also sharing any damage they receive.
description:
Ward an ally. They gain Resistance to all damage, and a +1 bonus to their ArmourClass and SavingThrows.
Each time the target takes damage, the spellcaster takes the same amount of damage.
notes:
* Also granted by the ring True Love's Embrace. The spell can only be cast once per Long Rest, and the target must be wearing the matching ring, True Love's Caress.
* Also granted by the shield Viconia's Walking Fortress.

name: Web
summary: This spell allows spellcasters to conjure a mass of sticky and flammable web at an area within range. Creatures moving or entering this area have their speed halved and can become Enwebbed.
description:
Cover an area in thick, flammable webbing that can Enwebbed|Enweb creatures within.

An ally can use its Help action to try and tear away the webs.
notes:
* This spell is also accessible to Beast Masters through Wolf Spider Companion.
* Spiderstep Boots grant immunity to Enwebbed|Enweb.

name: Wind Walk
summary: This spell allows spellcasters to transform a group of allies into a cloud of mist. This form offers damage Resistance, Advantage on some Saving Throws, and the ability to Fly.
description:
Transform yourself and all nearby party members into tiny clouds of mist to avoid attacks. You become Resistant to non-magical damage, gain Advantage on Tiny in size. You also gain the ability to Flight|Fly.

Prerequisite Icon While transformed, you won't be able to attack, cast spells, or talk.

name: Witch Bolt
summary: It allows spellcasters to hit enemies with a blue ray of electrifying energy that deals Lightning damage to them initially and also on subsequent turns.
description: Link yourself to a target with a bolt of lightning. Deal an additional 1d12|Lightning each turn by activating it.
higherLevels: Upcast: The initial damage increases by 1d12|Lightning per level.
notes: * Draconic Bloodline of Blue (Lightning) Ancestry learns this spell automatically.

name: Wrathful Smite
summary: This spell allows spellcasters to channel their wrath through their melee weapon, possibly Frightened|Frightening their target on hit.
description:
Your weapon absorbs your wrath as you strike, possibly Frightened|Frightening your target.

* If the spellcaster misses the initial Attack, the Spell Slot and Bonus Action are not consumed.
